title: Resolution problems
body:
so i just got a new monitor to hook up to my laptop for a bigger screen and had to change the in-game resolution so it would fit. 

but when i went to click on the correct resolution i accidentially selected the one below it, which ended up zooming in on the top left corner so much that i couldnt select a different resolution because i straight up couldnt see the menu so i had to alt tab and close league and when i tried starting it back up i got a bugsplat.

so the question is: can i change my in-game resolution if im not in game?

replies.body:
These bugsplats usually happen if you select a resolution that doesn't work for your display, so that's definitely what's going on here. In order to resolve this, we'll need to complete a reset of the configuration file saved server-side that has that incompatible resolution in it. First, log into League then minimize the client and navigate to the following directory:

>**C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config**

***Delete*** these two files inside the folder:
**- input.ini
- PersistedSettings.json**

After deleting those files, I'd like you to hop into a custom match so you can confirm whether or not that reset worked. Let me know the results!
